title: Karnataka to deploy Rs 67-crore AI tool to monitor social media, fight fake news
description: The Karnataka government has sanctioned an Artificial Intelligence-based platform to monitor online content and address digital threats, aiming to enhance public order and digital governance.
content: Karnataka will soon deploy an Artificial Intelligence-based tool to monitor social media in a bid to tackle fake news, misinformation and emerging digital threats across online platforms. The state Cabinet has approved the implementation of an AI-dri... [1842 chars]

title: Beyond the Hype: AI's Collective Intelligence Dilemma
description: The claim that artificial intelligence will soon surpass human intelligence is flawed. AI lacks the social, embodied, and collective dimensions that define human intelligence. While AI excels in narrow tasks, it cannot replicate the diversity, cooperation, and cultural understanding foundational to human cognition.
content: Melbourne, Feb 6 (The Conversation) – The notion that artificial intelligence might soon surpass human intelligence has gained considerable traction. Yet, experts argue that such claims overlook the essential social, embodied, and collective nature o... [658 chars]

title: IBM CEO Arvind Krishna warns AI could replace THESE Jobs: Is yours among them?
description: IBM CEO Arvind Krishna has warned that artificial intelligence could replace certain jobs in the coming years, prompting workers to ask whether their roles may be at risk.
content:

title: Indian IT stocks set for worst week in four months as AI jitters deepen
description: In a dramatic turn of events, Indian software shares fell sharply this Friday, leading to their toughest week in over four months. The spotlight is on artificial intelligence anxieties, which are weighing heavy on the high-margin income of IT companies.

title: Indian IT stocks set for worst week in four months as AI jitters deepen
description: Indian software exporters shares fell about 2% on Friday and were headed for their worst week in over four months, as rapid advances in artificial intelligence deepened worries that high-margin application-services revenues for Indian IT firms could come under pressure.

title: US software stocks slammed on mounting fears over AI disruption, lose $1 trillion in week
